summary:
I completed a Master of Human-Technology Interaction (HTI) from TU Eindhoven this summer. I switched my interest from Mechatronics, my Bachelor's program, to HTI, as my Master's program. Because I wanted to see more connections and possibilities between technology and humans. I found myself more interested in solving practical problems that people have or will have when they use a service or product. 

During the study of the master's program, I gained experience in both qualitative research and quantitative research, such as focus groups, interviews, surveys, user tests, statistic analyses in Stata, etc. I also got used to working in a multicultural environment with people of different specialized backgrounds. I've been exposed to multidisciplinary domains, for example, psychology, psychophysiology, cognitive engineering, perception, and of course, UX design. This knowledge, at a theoretical level, has made me more aware of the close connection between humans and technology and the infinite possibilities. I applied these knowledge to my projects and look forward to more practical opportunities in the future to convert theory into REAL innovations and improvements. 

Involving people in the development of a product is appealing to me. Scenarios, stories, inspiration, surprise, satisfaction, confusion, and difficulties that occur between humans and technology are motivations that prompt me into the UX field.  I love immersing myself in the process of digging, observing, and investigating the habits and needs of users. I enjoy seeking out novelty when facing new tasks or challenges. Seeing users from their past to the future and improving user experience with technology services will always be a challenging and fulfilling journey for me. I am open to a job related to UX as a starting point of my career.

projects.title: The Role of Appearance Qualities in the Attribution of Gender to Humanoid Robots
projects.description:
This project is my Master thesis project. In this project I started by doing literature research to learn more background knowledge of gender studies, anthropomorphic of robots, gender attribution/design to robots, and learned how to conduct quantitative research by focus groups. I cooperated with the LGBTQ+ community at TU/e to include diverse gender identities in this project. 
Three focus groups with people of different gender identities were conducted online and each of them lasted at least 60 minutes, the longest one lasted for about 90 minutes. These online discussions provided me with 77 pages of transcriptions (after transcribing, correcting, and formatting). With this huge amount of data, I used thematic analysis to explore the insights and present the results in a well-organized way.

In this Project, I...
- Cooperated with the LGBTQ+ community
- Conducted focus groups
- Succeeded in capturing every piece of information in great detail
- Produced informative and thorough descriptions of the data in Excel
- Visualized the main results with readable and concise presentations (e.g., boards and mind maps) in Miro
- Presented the project clearly and concisely with the key information selected from the detailed thesis

Tools: Excel, Miro, Mentimeter, Limesurvey, PowerPoint / Keynote
Skills: Quantitative Research Methods (Focus Group), Thematic Analysis

projects.title: AI‑driven Recipe Recommender Application
projects.description:
In this course project, I worked with three students who studied Industrial Design. We aimed to develop a personalized and AI-driven dinner recipe recommendation application that allows users to maximally use leftover ingredients in their pantry and fridge. We discussed the features for the application and I took the charge of data mining and documentation because I had more background knowledge about statistics. I used WEKA (a software for operating machine learning) as a starting point to understand machine learning and acquire skills in dealing with data. With the collected data, first I merged two datasets: the user profile dataset and the interaction log dataset. Then, I cleaned up these data. For example, removing incomplete instances, attributes without significant variations, re-grouping some numeric data to reduce dimensions and making the data to be more evenly distributed. I tested the data with different kinds of algorithms (e.g., J48, RandomForest, ZeroR) and selected suitable predictors to achieve decent and reasonable predicting results. The final prototype presents users with personalized recipe recommendations after submitting their personal profiles and offers a functionality to filter the datasets on their available ingredients.

In this project I...
- Discussed and constructed the conceptual interaction interface with teammates
- Created fake persona to add more variation to user profile attributes within the collected datasets
- Employed machine learning algorithms on the data through Weka to establish a prediction model suitable for integration in the application
- Gained an initial understanding of machine learning and got acquainted with some algorithms

Tools: Weka (Machine Learning), Xtensio (User Persona)
Skills: Data Mining, User Test, Machine Learning (Weka), Application Design (framework)

projects.title: Gender Differences on Health Goals and its Influence on Persuasiveness Technologies
projects.description:
This study investigated how different health goals, based on gender, are motivated in regard to light physical activity. A questionnaire followed by a week of using the Ommetje app (an application that encourages people to take daily walks) and an interview were performed. These answered the questions of whether men and women differ in their type of health goals and how they differ in their needs to support them in reaching these goals. 
I designed the questionnaire which was used to understand participants’ health goals, experience with walking supportive applications, and other demographic questions. And according to their health goals, I categorized participants into different types. Then, participants used a walking supportive application equipped with several persuasive features for one week. After using the application, I was also responsible for interviewing the participants interviewed to investigate behavioral and experiential feedback, such as duration of use and preference for persuasive features. 
I worked with a teammate to do the statistical analysis in Stata. I used t-test and regression for the data analysis and documented the analysis process and results.

In this project I...
- Designed a survey to identify different health goals and to categorize the participants based on their health goals
- Designed a survey to investigate behavioral and experiential feedback
- Applied appropriate statistical analysis (e.g., t-test, regression model) to the data and interpreted the results.
- Conducted interviews to get an understanding of the underlying reasons why certain features work better for certain participants and how this related to their health goals

Tools: Stata, Limesurvey
Skills: Statistic Analysis (Stata), Quantitative Research Methods (Interview), User Test, Survey Design

projects.title: Circle Projector on Shopping Cart
projects.description:
In this course project, I was introduced to the knowledge of UX design for the first time. I went through the process of UXD with my teammates. From empathizing to evaluating, I learned to do the very first iteration and gained some insights from these activities. The most impressive activity was learning how to conduct empathizing activity via interviews with potential users to explore their actual demands. Except conducting interviews independently, I also completed the affinity diagram, creating codes and themes, brainwriting, COCD Box task and scenario writing with my teammates reading the texts online, summarizing and sorting the information. 
At the end of the project, my teammates and I made a storyboard with a video demonstration as a prototype to introduce the technology which could help people adhere to the 1.5-meter distance measure during the COVID time. The main technology that was chosen for the prototype consists of a light projector that will be attached to the bottom of a shopping cart, that will project a light circle with a diameter of 1.5-meter around the shopping cart user. I was responsible for editing the video pitch according to the script that was discussed by the group.

In this Project, I...
- Conducted semi-structured interviews to get a thorough, contextually appropriate representation of the target group 
- Analyzed the transcribed interviews, transformed the data into affinity diagrams and categorized topics into themes in Miro with teammates
- Used a brain writing method to generate possible solutions to the problem and applied COCD box to cluster the ideas based on the level of innovation and feasibility with teammates
- Evaluated the low fidelity prototype (storyboard) with the “I like, I wish, What if”-method to organized the feedback
- Edited video pitch to present the design

Tools: Miro, Adobe Premiere
Skills: Quantitative Research Methods (Interview), User Test, Thematic Analysis, Video Editing

projects.title: Website Development of a Management System for Combine Harvester
projects.description:
Grade: 3.7/4.0

This is my Bachelor graduation project. In this project, I learned from scratch how to do front-end development and connect the back-end database to the web pages. This is also the project which inspired me to turn my interest to human-technology interaction. 
In this project, I designed and developed the a website of management system for combine harvesters. The target users are mainly two kinds of people: technicians in factory (i.e., admins) and farmers (i.e., users). They would have different needs for the website, thus I differentiated and diverted them at login, navigating them to the corresponding site frames. For example, admins had to have a holistic view of the products all over different regions, therefore, I arranged the Failures Summary module in the framework for admins and also allowed them to sort by failure types and regions. For users, it would be helpful if they could have the guidance or manual when their machines break down because in this way they could deal with the problem by their own. Hence, I set up a Troubleshooting module for the users and also have a page of Contact in case users could not solve the problem after their own try.

In this Project, I...
- Analyzed the functional needs of the website for different target groups
- Developed a website with a simple interface and the ability to communicate with the back-end database
- Separated these functions into small modules and designed the web layout
- Connected some parts of the front-end to the database via PHP file, and after searching and comparing data, leaded to different types of homepages (i.e., for admins or users) or displays the required information
- Used PHP Data Objects (PDO) to connect to the database and transfer the corresponding data by distinguishing the device name
- Used Echarts to visualize the data

Tools: Wampserver, Dreamweaver, Navicat, ECharts
Skills: Web develop, Data visualization

projects.title: Intelligent Waste Sorting System
projects.description:
Grade: 4.0/4.0
Video: https://youtu.be/WdSnY4wvsec
This design aimed to make a intelligent waste sorting system via speech recognition device and phone application. This project was a part of the summer course. I worked with two teammate for two weeks, from defining the problems to building the prototype and filming the video demonstration. 
In details, the speech recognition function was divided into the voice recognition module embedded in the control terminal and the recognition APP installed in the phone. By collecting the user's voice information and reducing the environmental noise, the effective voice information was transformed into recognizable words and matched with the words in the waste sorting phrases library. After the voice recognition information was successfully matched with the words in the library, the specific information was transmitted to the control terminal, and the information was transmitted to the human-computer interaction system to complete the voice interaction by making the specific voice response audible through the speaker. The control terminal controlled the corresponding mechanical structure after receiving the specific signal to make the right trash can lid open, and waited for the user to put the waste in the trash can. The device could be equipped with an induction system to close the lid automatically or close the lid after command was recognized.

In this project I...
- Developed the application used for speech recognition via Bluetooth connection
- Draw the circuit simulation in Proteus
- Design the prototype, including connections between each part, props and the scenario
- Filmed and edited the video demonstration, combining stop motion with mock up scenario to make the presentation more entertained

Tools: Arduino, Adobe Premiere, Proteus
Skills: Application develop, Video editing
